author: BBC Earth
description:
From rattlesnakes in Arizona to grizzly bears in Alaska, watch as naturalist Nick Baker gets as close as he to dares some of the world's wildest animals.

These clips are taken from 'Deep into the Wild' (2001)
Nick Baker is on a mission to get as close as he dares to some of the world's wildest animals in some of the most untamed places on the planet. He spends five days in the beautiful Kingdom of Swaziland, home to the endangered black and white rhinos. He travels to Arizona in search of rattlesnakes. He visits Antarctica, where he crosses some of the world's most treachero
title: Getting Close to the World's Wildest Animals | BBC Earth
